Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Scaraboid
Description: Green faience scaraboid carved on both surfaces. The recto is adorned with a recumbent sphinx whose royal head bears the blue crown, protected at the front by a vulture with spread-out wings and, at the back, a winged serpent. The verso is inscribed with a text which mentions Menkheperre (Thutmosis III) as the "Son of Amun, Prince of Ipet-Sut (Karnak)".
